sep.tinee.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.tinee.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Server is a minimal but adequately functional and robust Tinee server for you to develop and test your client against.

    The argument required to run the server corresponds to Server(int): the port number that the server should listen on.

    You can compile and run this server using NetBeans; e.g., right-click this file in the NetBeans editor and select "Run File". Note, to provide the above argument, you should set up a run configuration for this class: -> "Set Project Configuration" -> "Customize..." -> "New..." -- the "Main Class" is sep.tinee.server.Server, and write the port value (e.g., 8888) in "Arguments".

    Assuming compilation using NetBeans (etc.), you can also run Server from the command line, e.g., on Windows, run:

    • C:\...\tinee> java -cp build\classes sep.tinee.server.Server 8888

    Note: On some platforms (e.g., Windows), you may be prompted with a security warning due to the server opening a network socket. You must grant this permission for the server to function properly.

    An instance of Server understands and communicates the messages in sep.tinee.net.message.

    • Bye - tells the Server to end this communication session with the client.
    • ShowRequest - request the set of ticket tags and creators (user names) recorded by the Server.
      • ShowReply - the Server's reply: the set of ticket tags and creators (possibly empty).
    • ReadRequest - request the (sub)list of tines recorded by the Server for the specified tag, from the specified index (inclusive, starting from index 0). Note: The tag may not be explicitly recorded by the Server.
      • ReadReply - the Server's reply: the list of tines (possibly empty).
    • Push - append a non-empty list of tines to each (possibly new) tag in the non-empty set of ticket tags.

    Your client should use ClientChannel top send and receive messages of the above types with a server: see the ClientChannel.send(Message) and ClientChannel.receive() methods.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server socket could not be opened

      • Server

        public Server(boolean debug,
              int port)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new Tinee server, bound to the specified port, with debug output enabled or disabled.
        Parameters:
        debug - Enable or disable local debug output printing (true means enabled)
        port - The port number that the servSock will listen on
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server socket could not be opened
